section.section: The Board consists of seven members appointed by the Governor, with the advice of the Secretary, and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member of the Board is 3 years.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member from the Board for incompetence, misconduct, neglect of duty, or other sufficient cause.
